intro: Echinops taygeteus, commonly known as the Greek thistle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region, particularly Greece and Turkey, and is characterized by its spiny, spherical seed heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces blue to purple flowers in the summer months. Its leaves are gray-green and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are upright and branched. Echinops taygeteus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and drought tolerance.
